attributes.action: No 2nd Referendum For The Leaving Of The European Union.
attributes.additional_details:
Democracy has always been the backbone of our country where every person of the correct voting age can use their voice to vote for that they believe is correct. 

On that day 23rd Of June 2016, 17.4 Million people voted to leave the European union. 

Now the remainers are trying to take away those votes to try to force a 2nd referendum to revoke Article 50 from going ahead and to try to stay in the EU.

17.4 Million people have spoken, they said LEAVE!!!
attributes.background: The referendum was held on Thursday, 23 June, 2016, to decide whether the UK should leave or remain in the European Union. To leave won by 51.9% Or 17.4 Million to 48.1%.Or 16.1 Million. The referendum turnout was 71.8%, with more than 30 million people voting.
